intro: Henckelia scabrinervia, commonly known as the rough-veined henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and have a rough, hairy texture, contributing to its common name. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky slopes.
